items.title: Interconnection queues are becoming the hidden bottleneck for new data center load
items.tldr: Queue timelines, network upgrade costs, and deliverability requirements are increasingly the gating factors for hyperscale load growth — even where generation is available.

items.title: Why synchronous condensers are back in the spotlight for weak-grid stability
items.tldr: As inverter-based resources increase, utilities are leaning on synchronous condensers for short-circuit strength, inertia-like response, and voltage control — especially in weak-grid regions.

items.title: Rare earth supply risk: the next 6–18 months may reshape magnet pricing and lead times
items.tldr: Policy moves, export controls, and new refining capacity announcements can rapidly swing NdFeB magnet availability. Procurement teams should prepare for volatility and dual-sourcing pressure.
